column1: "inputs": "### Instruction: Tell me more about the project 'Smart Parking Space Detection System Using Image Processing (Parkin)'?\n\n### Response: 'Parkin' is a project that involves the development of a smart parking space detection system using image processing techniques. By analyzing images from cameras installed in parking lots
column2: this project aims to detect and identify available parking spaces in real-time. It can provide valuable information to drivers
column3: enabling them to find parking spots more efficiently and reduce traffic congestion."

column1: "inputs": "### Instruction: Tell me more about the project 'Automatic Grading of Short-Answer Questions.'\n\n### Response: The project 'Automatic Grading of Short-Answer Questions' focuses on developing an automated system for grading short-answer questions. By utilizing natural language processing and machine learning techniques
column2: this project aims to analyze and evaluate students' responses to short-answer questions
column3: providing objective and consistent grading. It has the potential to save time for teachers and provide immediate feedback to students."

column1: "inputs": "### Instruction: Tell me about the Community Service Activities in the Academic Year 2022-2023 at the College of Computer Science and Information Technology.\n\n### Response: In the Academic Year 2022-2023
column2: the College organized several community service activities
column3: including: \n 1. Safety5 (Date: 01/09/2022) - Organized by Dr. Khalid Alissa
column9: Dr. May Aldossary. The initiative aimed at raising awareness against cyber dangers
column10: such as cyberbullying and social engineering
column11: among teenagers in high school and middle schools in the eastern province. It provided 351 hours of service to the public and private schools. \n 2. Don't throw your computer (Date: 19/3/2023) - Organized by Dr. Yasser Bamarouf

column17: and donating them to low-income students at the university. The initiative was carried out in partnership with Irtiqaa charity and the IAU Directorate of Community Partnerships."

column1: "inputs": "### Instruction: Tell me more about the project 'Automated Crop Disease Detection and Classification.'\n\n### Response: The project 'Automated Crop Disease Detection and Classification' aims to develop an automated system for detecting and classifying diseases in crops. "inputs": "### Instruction: Tell me more about the Scientific Cooperation and Exchange of Experiences Initiative within the Saudi Aramco Cybersecurity Chair.

### Response: The Scientific Cooperation and Exchange of Experiences Initiative within the Saudi Aramco Cybersecurity Chair is supervised by Dr. Khalid Alissa and Dr. Abdullah Almuhaideb. It has several key objectives and sub-initiatives:

1. Building Channels of Communication: This initiative aims to create collaborative channels with cybersecurity researchers and research centers globally to strengthen cooperative alliances and investigate cybersecurity objectives more effectively.

2. Community Service and School Visits: The chair collaborates with schools to raise awareness about cybercrime and cybersecurity
column2:
especially among adolescents. It prepares content reviewed by cybersecurity specialists at the college.

3. Training Programs: Offering diverse training programs and workshops to develop cybersecurity skills for both specialists and non-specialists in the field.

4. Support for Professional Certificates: Supporting and encouraging students to obtain professional certificates in cybersecurity by covering 50% of the test fees.

5. Student Competition: Hosting an annual competition to recognize talented students in the field of cybersecurity and providing training courses for high-ranking participants.

6. Advisory Board Directives: Leveraging the expertise of an advisory board comprising individuals with diverse experiences in industry
column3: academia
column4: and government sectors to provide guidance and support.\n\n7. Supporting the Industrial Sector: Focusing on projects in the industrial sector
column5: encouraging students to invest their research in areas that support industrial development
column6: and publishing distinct research in prestigious journals.\n\nThese initiatives collectively contribute to enhancing cybersecurity knowledge
column8: and awareness both locally and internationally."

column3: and assist caregivers in remotely monitoring and supervising children
